author: A_Brickset_user
title: Best in 2004
review: This is simply awsome, i got the set  today and this has got to be one of the best sets i have ever bought, this thing is like a foot tall. on the site it says its like 11 inches, and has a good selektion of mech joints, duh its a mech set. my summary is GET THIS SET

author: A_Brickset_user
review: This is great. The new joints are too hard too move very fast but they are very good for posing. The big robot uses almost all the pieces. Theres like 10 to 20 left over. Its very heavy and tall, like 1 foot and 4 er 5 inches. I dont no i didnt measure but it shure is tall.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Impressive, yet....
review:
Pro's:
It's big, has nice styling and contains lots of usefull pieces.

Con's:
Terrible colors, red instead of the orange and a darker shade of blue would be better

Slightly oversized feet and the worst possible hands

The joint connecting the upper and lower body is too loose, it should have more friction for better posing

A bit too fragile, keep away from little kids or it will be in pieces soon.

Still, a very nice set. Lego should release more of these kinds of sets.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: No, I'm not dead.
review:
More pros'n' cons. I really should find a better format for reviews, but...

PROS:
It's big. Really big. Really, really big.
The new grey actually suits the model very well, IMHO.
Good posability.
Looks cool. I know this is basic, but it really does. 
The backpack is very well done, in particular.
The new "round" clicky hinges are good for mechs.
Did I mention it's big?

CONS:
The head is too small.
Legs for hands. Eeeeeewwwww....
Quite fragile.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: allright
review: This set is allright. It looks good and has heeps of peices. The only problem is that the main model, the Titan XP is far to flimsy. but i found that if you turn it around and take off the circle head you have another robot. This is the one thats on the back. It looks good. I like this set alot and i think that it is resonably priced. Good work Lego!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Holy Gigantic Mecha.
review: This set has it all, cool pieces, awesome size for money, and a cool color scheme. When I saw this set in some pictures from a toy fair I said "Ho, I am gonna get this set." I looked in Toys R Us for some Bionicles and I came across the Titan. I instantly asked my Mom for it, and she said yes. "Booyah!"

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Best of 2004
review: The new year is upon us, and I feel this was the best of 2004.  The colors are nice (I must be the only guy who likes the Ice Planet colors).  The robot main model is very impresive but VERY fragile.  Had this been a 'normal' model I would have taken off a point, but there are many robots and it has an ABUNDANCE of bricks; I really like those 1x3 curves, I would love a supplimentary pack of just those in basic colors.  All in all, best set of this year.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: titan xp is the best!
review: this is one of the BEST designer sets of 2004? other than the prehistoric creatures designer set, this is actually cool. there's about 780 pieces and i think that you should sort out all the pieces before using them.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Too big, too bad.
review:
I'll admit, it has a certain appeal when seeing it in the store.  That's an awful lot of bricks going on right there.  And the alternate designs & idea book look cool.  But that's about where the coolness stops.
It's kinda repetitive to build (ie not fun).  I's almost impossible t play with because it's so fragile, and can't support it's own weight.  It can strike some pretty darn cool poses though.  If you can get it to stay there.
Maybe this is just me, but I had a heck of a time understanding Lego's color mastering skills when going thought the book.  the 2 greys & blue looked very much alike, and the orange was yellow in the book.
Finally, the head doesn't turn.  4 seperate movalbe skirts of armor articulate, but the head doesn't move.  That's weak.
The only reason I gave it more than a 3 is because it does have shock value, is imposing & impressive, and is pretty articulate.
Not fun to build, not fun to play with.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Not bad...
review: Pretty good model with the fact that its constructed with little to none technic pieces. The only SAD part about this set are the hands of the robot. Lego figure legs??!!! Give me a break. The head should have been bigger too. I bet LEGO can do better than that. However, if you're interested in the coolness of this model, go buy it. Quite worth the money.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Very impressive
review:
I really like this set a lot. The colour scheme is so perfect. Especially the orange colour here and there. 

It is a nice display set together with 4097 (Mini robots), 4099 (Robobots) and 4881 (Robo Platoon). 

However, I would like to deduct 0.5 because of the joint between the upper and lower body. Once, I was holding the upper body of it (without supporting the lower one), the whole lower body dropped onto the floor. After re-building it, the joints of the lower body have become loose. If it is not well positioned, it will fall down (unlike before, i could bend it whatever way i like).

Play on

author: A_Brickset_user
title: LOOK, A MECH SET THAT IS NOT MADE OF THREE PIECES, IT MUST SUCK
review:
This is the best Mech set ever. Peroid.

Why? I'm going to unleash my inner geek to explain. 

- PROS OF MODEL: -

A) It stands over a foot high
B) It has great gray and black pieces
C) It has no weaponary, which, I am led to assume, is why most people hated it
D) Leg design is creative and very cool looking
E) Most body parts are movable
F) Detachable jetpack
G) It's hard to build. That's a PRO, folks. It's good to have a set that requires some brainpower and some talent. NOTE THE AGE RANGE ON THE BOX. If you are below that level, don't expect to have fun with it. 

- CONS OF MODEL - 

A) Head often falls off.
B) It's rather shaky, not recommended for rigorous play 

Pros > Cons

Therfore,

Titan XP = Ownage

Buy it if you can.

author: Matn
title: Finnaly, I bought it!
review: Three years later (from the release) I bought the set. It was yesterday, for only 29 euro! That's so cheap! Everybody buyed the set for, like, 60 euro so I'm very happy. Overall it's a nice set, it's huge, really. Unlike others I don't have the problem that is doesn't stands like it has to, it's perfect here. He stands in de most positions and doesn't fall. The colorsheme is sweet and the legs and arms are so cool. The (removable) jetpack is innovative. The whole mecha is innovative. I don't like the hands that mutch, it could been better. And the head is just 'ok', it could also been better. I give this set a 5; because for his 29 euro it's fantastic!

author: LegoAficionado
title: Exo-Force had nothing on this big guy
review:
Just recently, I was lucky enough to find this set with all of its pieces still in its original box, and I wondered to myself, why I had not rebuilt it before. 

So setting aside about two or so hours, and after rummaging through the box for the most part, I rebuilt the Titan XP.

In my opinion this is the best Designer set I have ever owned, and was a much better improvement to the 2003 robot designer set. So let's get on with the review.

*As a side note, since there are no minifigs in this set, I will cover the main models the instruction booklet provides, starting with the easy build, then the experienced build, followed by the master build.

The Easy Build:

The easy build for this set is as lego put it, easy. There really is not much to say here, but I do like how the easy build allows you to have two robots, whereas the other two builds only create one robot. For the most part, though the build is easy, the cool things that lego does with the build make it a fun experience. 

The downside to the easy build is that, 1. they are not complex robots, and 2. the mobility of the robots are minimal. 

Pros:
-fun and entertaining build
-easy build for those just getting into legos

Cons: 
-not really all that exciting to look at in comparison to the other builds
-minimal articulation
Overall: a 3/5

The Experienced Build:

The experienced build has you make a somewhat of a metal gear rex model, honestly that is the only thing this robot looks like to me. And yet again, as lego gauged it well, the build is more for those whom like to build legos but are not necessarily up to building really big models. 

Unlike the last build, this model is really articulated and is very big. The main focus in this build is in the legs, but the upper body has a nice design, and overall it is a great model.

Pros:
-Cool designed robot
-Nice articulation
-Better building experience

Cons:
None really for this model

Overall: a 4/5

The Master (Advanced) Build:

Now this is the build I am sure everyone who bought this set, went for. I know I built this model the moment I opened this set. Titan XP is the main feature here and he does not disappoint so lets start.

The largest portion of the build takes place in the legs, and let me tell you, these legs have to be the most fully articulated legs I have ever seen in any Lego set as of back then and right now. If I total the points of articulation, I believe they come out to over 4 different areas to move the legs, but at least hundreds of different positions. The build is tedious for the legs, but once you have them done, they look AMAZING. The upper torso and the arms is the shorter build but nonetheless they are my favorite part to build of the Titan XP. The upper torso is well designed and the jet-pack is very nice. The arms may be a little too short, but they are very well designed again.

The finished product stands over 1 foot and it is quite heavy. But in the end the build makes you feel accomplished and the Titan XP has so much detail that you bet whoever designed this set, felt accomplished as well. The playability of the set is a little hindered because the set is so fragile, but it does not fall short of being there just to be admired.

Pros:
-Most satisfying build you will have in a long time
-Beautiful design
-Full articulation, just like a human
-Great for showcasing and impressing others
Cons: 
-Very fragile
-Legs are tedious to build

Overall: this model is the best of all three so it gets a 5/5

This set is great for tons of pieces and some really cool models, but do not forget that Lego made these sets so that people not only built the models but also had the inspiration to build their own models, so I believe this set is inspired by the meaning of the word lego. 

If you can find this set now, do not let the opportunity to buy it pass up, this is a jewel of a set, and I am glad I saved all of the pieces in one location. 

*If you want to see my other reviews check out my profile here

author: Hob
title: Great set glad i bought it.
review:
Having only just back in to lego and found this site i wasn't sure what sets were out there to buy first.  I looked here and found some set i owned in the past and then looked at the ebay section and I'm glad i found this set on ebay and bought it for 4.99.

It came quickly and i decided to sit down and build it last night, which took two sittings and about 3hours (or so) had to stop and strecth legs a few times.

The main robot is amazing and is huge.  The only concern is the fact that it's a little top heavy and looks like it may fall over at any min.  Not sure if that's due to my parts being used before ir just a design flaw.

The only other thing i find with the instructions were the colour scheme sometimes i wish the balcks, greys and blues were better colured as i found it difficult to match some of the brincks the foot guards inperticullar, might just be me though.

Anyway thats it really i would reccomned this set to everyone.

author: modena
title: This one is big, and he still has a jet-pack and wings? Still Awesome!
review:
I got this set long ago. It is hard to build. Once I took it apart, then I got angry at myself!

For 5 or so years, I actually didn't like this set, it was so unstable. That was until I discovered I had made the feet to long. Now it is great, and free-standing! 

Pros

  • Awesome bricks!
  • Rare colours, such as Orange and light-bluish-grey.
  • Chrome-silver plates!
  • Big wing plates!
  • Main model has jet-pack!
  • Thousands of poses!
  • Hard to build!
  • Lots of ideas!
  • Torso can swivel about!

Cons

  • Sometimes falls over.
  • Yes, heavy model.
  • The legs can sometimes get caught and stuck in the 4 oscillating plates around this Titan's waist.
  • If you don't follow the instructions carefully, this one might have problems.

Overall:

I will just briefly describe the B and C models. The C model is just two robots. One has a head like a leopard, the other one I have forgotten. The B model is one great walking pod. His legs are opened toward the side, and technically, when he swings open his legs horizontally, he should be able to fly. I love how the designers have fitted the 'wings' to make a hull in the B model. When i rebuild this set, I might post some photos. (You will have to wait a lot!) There are many other ideas in this book, but don't try to build them. They are big, and too hard to copy! 

I will try to keep this part short. This is a very good set. If you are a Lego fan who likes to build and display, this is the right set for you. Challenging building and lots of colours. Even if you are a Lego fan which likes to play with it, you might still find this set interesting. Just take care when playing with it, and look carefully when building the feet.

Overall, get this set. Your happiness will depend on how you play with Lego sets. people who like to display stuff might find more use than people who like to play.

author: metalsynkk
title: Great set, I was playing almost forever.
review:
This was my third Designer set I got, and from the very first sight of it I was just wanting it, so I got my mom to buy it. I played, well, 2 years almost with only this one set, and it never got boring. There are enough parts, and anough moving parts, as I'm a large fan of that (I also own the Robobots and Wild Collection Designer Sets, also for the moving parts xD).

 

Just to mention, I sold the set once when I needed money, but I have now rebought it (3 years later) as I remembered how much fun it was. I think Lego isn't bound to a particular age, I played alot between my 9th and 14th year, but now I'm 18 and it's still fun to do it sometimes. The creativity is enormous, and with me being fan of scifi and mechanics, this is one of the greatest sets I've ever had.

author: imnewhere
title: A great display piece
review:
A good, solid robot. I got this for my birthday and was not disappointed  . As far as I know, it is the biggest mech or robot to date. (I define mech and robot as two legged, just to clarify)

Box/Instructions

Just your normal stuff, nothing special.

Parts

A lot of similar  parts, but nothing really out of the ordinary today. Has some unique parts in sand blue and orange, so if you need parts in those colors, this set could be for you.

Minifigures

None.

The build

I only built the main model, cause once it was built, it looked so cool I couldn't destroy it. Simple techniques used to good effect, some snot. Took me maybe 2 hours.

The completed model

This is where it really shines. The final model looks powerful and imposing, just as a robot should. It is a little flimsy around the waist, so if you want to play with it I suggest you build one of the other two models. This giant looks great towering over a car or minifig, or just standing around. I highly recommend it to robot fans and people who just want to display it, as it is a impressive model.

Overall opinion

I like this set, in case you couldn't tell. My only problems with it are a flimsy waist and the fact that the head is a little small, but it doesn't bother me much. I think this designers really hit the jackpot with this set, and I wish they would do more like this in the future. Preferably even bigger than this one.

author: bluelemon
title: Titan XP is a great set
review: I loved this set when I got it. It was amazing in my 5 yr. old mind, and unfortunately, I didn't build the actual robot because of lack of experience. The intermediate build is great, and it has great playability. Overall, it's a great set and I would get another one if I could.
